Welcome to the Step-By-Step Getting Started Guide!
==================================================

                        <tr>

                              <td colspan="3" align="left"> <!--change to 8 for new box-->

                                 <div style="margin-bottom:20px;">Your personal guide to take you from zero-to-hero with SpecFlow. Whether you are a veteran user or have never heard of SpecFlow we have something for you.</div>

                              </td>

                        </tr>

                        <tr>

                              <td  valign="top">

                                 <div style="padding: 10px 20px; -webkit-box-shadow: 0 0 20px 0 #ccc; box-shadow: 0 0 20px 0 #ccc; min-height: 420px;">

                                    <h4 style="font-size: 22px font-weight:bold; color:#574897; border-bottom: 3px solid #574897; padding-bottom: 4px;">Start here if you are new to SpecFlow</h4>

                                    <p>In this guide you will learn to create your first SpecFlow project and automate a simple Gherkin specification against a sample application.</p>

                                    Prerequisites:

                                    <ul>

                                          <li>Basic understanding of C#</li>

                                          <li>Visual Studio 2017 or later</li>

                                          <li>JetBrains Rider 2020.3.1 or later</li>

                                    </ul>

                                    <p>

                                          Choose your favourite IDE below and follow the steps<br>

                                          <em><font size="-1">*Estimated completion time: 60 minutes</font></em>

                                    </p>

                                 </div>

                              </td>

                              <td></td> <!--copy paste these three lines for new box-->

                              <td  valign="top">

                                 <div style="padding: 10px 20px; -webkit-box-shadow: 0 0 20px 0 #ccc; box-shadow: 0 0 20px 0 #ccc; height: 100%; min-height: 420px;">

                                    <h4 style="font-size: 22px font-weight:bold; color:#574897; border-bottom: 3px solid #574897; padding-bottom: 4px;">Guides for more advanced users</h4>

                                    <p>We have put together the below guides for more advanced users who have used SpecFlow before and are looking for more concrete examples or like to use additional automation libraries with SpecFlow.</p>

                                    <ul>

                                          <li>Bookshop project: Learn, explore and experiment with a sample web application project using SpecFlow and SpecFlow+ Runner</li>

                                          <li>Selenium project: A UI automation project using Selenium with Page Object Model Pattern</li>

                                    </ul>

                                 </div>

                              </td> <!--copy paste these three lines for new box-->

                        </tr>

                                 <div style="margin-bottom:40px; margin-top:40px; ">
                                 If you don’t fall into the category of users mentioned above then we recommend you to <a href="https://go.specflow.org/a1h">learn more about SpecFlow </a> before pairing up with a more technical person and going through one of these guides.
                                 </div>

                              </td>

                        <hr size="10" width="100%" color=#574897>

                        

                        <P>Do you need any further help?<br></br>



                        <a href="https://go.specflow.org/11w">Join our next onboarding webinar</a> to help you get started with SpecFlow.<br></br>

                        

                        You can also get help by reaching out to our support team <a href="https://go.specflow.org/nfg">here<a/>.<br></br>

                        </P>
